description: Redevelopment comprising a two-storey residential building with basement and roof level accommodation to provide nine self-contained flats (following demolition of existing dwellinghouse); and associated amenity spaces, cycle storage, refuse storage, and vehicle parking
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings titles: 17/002/P01; 17/002/P02 Rev. B; 17/002/P03 Rev. B; 17/002/P04 Rev. B; 17/002/P05 Rev. A; 17/002/P06; 17/002/P07; 17/002/P08; 17/002/P09 Rev. A; 17/002/P10 Rev. A; and 17/002/P11 Rev. A.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning, and to ensure that the developments harmonise with the existing building and surrounding area in accordance with policies 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016). | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surrounding area in accordance with policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016); 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012); and 7B, 7C and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013). | Development shall not commence (including demolition and site clearance) until a Demolition Method Statement and Construction Management Plan have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

The Demolition Method Statement shall include details on control measures for dust, noise, vibration, lighting, delivery locations, restriction of hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary to 08:00-18:00hrs Mondays to Fridays and 08:00-13:00 hrs on Saturdays, and public display of contact details including accessible phone contact to persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.
The Construction Management Plan to be submitted shall include the following information:
a)	on-site construction worker parking;
b)	anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site;
c)	delivery times and booking system (staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school run peak periods);
d)	site access for construction traffic and contractor staff parking and associated signage;
e)	consolidated or re-timed trips;
f)	site security;
g)	secure, off-street loading and drop-off facilities;
h)	vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including swept path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear;
i)	details as to the locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors' offices;

j)	procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents including the name, telephone number and address of a responsible person to whom enquiries / complaints should be directed. These contact details shall also be displayed at regular intervals around the site compound;
k)	using TfL's Freight Operator Recognition Scheme (FORS) or similar; and

l)	details of control measures for dust, noise, vibration, lighting, delivery locations, restriction of hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary to 08:00-18:00hrs Mondays to Fridays and 08:00-13:00 hrs on Saturdays, and the advance notification to neighbours and other interested parties of proposed works.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the approved Construction Management Plan for the duration of the works.

Reason: To ensure appropriate mitigation measures to protect the amenity of local residents and ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies policies 6.3, 6.13, 7.13, 7.14 and 7.15  of the London Plan (2016); 1.1(e)(j) and 2.1(c) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006); and BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise. | Prior to commencement of the development, a detailed Screening Assessment for groundwater flooding shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing. The Screening Assessment must be prepared by an individual who is a Hydrogeologist that is a Chartered Member of the Geological Society and/or Registered Ground Engineering Professional (with the Institute of Civil Engineers). In addition to either confirming a low risk of impact or advising the level of impact and the associated mitigation actions proposed, the Screening Assessment must also include:
-	A description of the proposed basement development;
-	Construction methods proposed;

-	Characteristics of potential impacts (including the impact on soils, land use, water quality and hydrology with descriptions of the nature & scale of impacts and the extent of the impacted area); and
-	Details of mitigation measures (where appropriate).

Reason: To demonstrate that the proposed development is appropriately flood resilient and resistant, in accordance with policies 7.13 of the London Plan (2016); 1.2(m) of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and 4.1 of the West London Strategic Flood Risk Assessment (2018). | In the event of contamination to land and/or water being encountered during site clearance, demolition or development, no development shall continue until the following is submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority:

(a)	An intrusive contaminated land investigation and risk assessment of the site. This shall be carried out in accordance with BS1075:2011+A1:2013 and CR11 guidance to assess the nature and extent of any contamination on the site. This assessment must be undertaken by a competent person, and shall assess any contamination on the site, whether or not it originates on the site.

(b)	A remediation (de-contamination) scheme to bring the site to a condition suitable for the intended residential use. It shall include all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria, timetable of works and site management procedures. The scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated lands under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended residential use of the land after remediation.
Following completion of measures identified in the approve remediation (de-contamination) scheme Part (B):

(c)	A verification report that demonstrates the completion of measures identified in the approved contamination remediation scheme shall be produced. The report shall be completed in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination (Report: SC030114/R1)'.

In the event that no contamination is encountered, a written statement confirming this was the case shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the development.

In either event, all excavated soils / material must be correctly disposed of and waste transfer tickets proving correct disposal of excess waste soils has taken place shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that any ground and water contamination is identified and adequately addressed, any excess waste being properly disposed, and the development site is not polluted to the detriment of future workers and occupants pursuant in accordance with polices 5.21 of the London Plan (2016); and 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | No demolition or development shall take place until a Stage 1 written scheme of investigation (WSI) has been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing. For land that is included within the WSI, no demolition or development shall take place other than in accordance with the agreed WSI, the programme and methodology of site evaluation, and the nomination of a competent person(s) or organisation to undertake the agreed works.

If heritage assets of archaeological interest are identified by Stage 1, then for those parts of the site which have archaeological interest a Stage 2 WSI shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing. For land that is included within the Stage 2 WSI, no demolition/development shall take place other than in accordance with the agreed stage 2 WSI which shall include:

A.	The statement of significance and research objectives, the programme and methodology of site investigation. and recording and the nomination of a competent person(s) or organisation to undertake the agreed works.

B.	The programme for post-investigation assessment and subsequent analysis, publication & dissemination and deposition of resulting material. This part of the condition shall not be discharged until these elements have been fulfilled in accordance with the programme set out in the Stage 2 WSI.

Reason: To ensure that the archaeological features are protected, in accordance with policies 7C of the Ealing Management Development Plan (2013); and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016). | A minimum of one (1) 1,110 litre bin dedicated to recycling and one (1) 1,110 litre bin dedicated to refuse shall be provided as shown in the Approved Plans listed in Condition 2 and in accordance with adopted standards of the Local Planning Authority. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies 5.17 of the London Plan (2016); 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); and 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | A minimum of sixteen (16) cycle parking spaces shall be provided within covered and secured cycle storage facilities as shown in the Approved Plans listed in Condition 2 and in accordance with adopted standards of the London Plan (2016). Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.

Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016). | Notwithstanding the three (3) balconies proposed in the drawings listed in Condition 2, no part of any roof shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2016). | Prior to first occupation, the landscaping and single off-street parking space shown on the approved drawings listed in Condition shall be provided to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority and retained thereafter for the duration of the use.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and sufficient vehicle parking is provided, in accordance with policies 6.3, 6.13, 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016); 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012); and 7B, 7C and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013). | No trees that are shown to be retained in the Approved Plans listed in Condition 2 shall be felled, uprooted, wilfully damaged or destroyed, cut back in any way or removed. Any trees removed without consent or dying or being severely damaged or becoming seriously diseased within five (5) years from the completion of the development hereby permitted shall be replaced in accordance with trees of similar size and species unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To secure protection of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within the site which are of amenity value to the area in accordance with policies 5.10 of the London Plan (2016); 1.1 (e) (i) and 1.2 (d) of the Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012); and 5.10 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013).
